instruction: Come up with healthy and easy dinner ideas for weeknights.
output:
1. Grilled Chicken and Vegetable Salad: Marinate chicken breasts in a mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and herbs. Grill the chicken and serve it over a bed of mixed greens with cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onions. Drizzle with a balsamic vinaigrette dressing.

2. Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables: Season salmon fillets with salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Bake in the oven until cooked through. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Roast vegetables such as asparagus, bell peppers, and zucchini with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Serve the salmon over the quinoa with the roasted vegetables on the side.

3. Turkey and Avocado Wraps: Slice cooked turkey breast and avocado. Add lettuce, tomato, and a drizzle of ranch dressing to a whole wheat tortilla. Roll up and enjoy.

4. Vegetable Stir-Fry: Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add a tablespoon of oil and stir-fry vegetables such as broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, and snow peas. Add a sauce made from soy sauce, rice vinegar, and honey. Serve over brown rice or quinoa.

5. Chicken and Vegetable Soup: Saute onions, garlic, and carrots in olive oil. Add chicken broth, diced chicken, and frozen vegetables. Simmer until the vegetables are tender. Serve with a slice of whole grain bread.

6. Black Bean and Corn Tacos: Cook black beans and corn in a skillet with a little oil. Season with cumin, chili powder, and lime juice. Serve in tacos shells with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, and avocado.

7. Omelette with Vegetables: Whisk eggs with salt and pepper. Add diced vegetables such as bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms. Cook in a non-stick skillet until the eggs are set. Serve with a side salad.

8. Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Tomato Soup: Grill two slices of whole grain bread with cheese. Serve with a bowl of tomato soup.

9. Baked Sweet Potato with Tuna Salad: Bake a sweet potato in the oven until tender. Mix canned tuna with mayonnaise, diced celery, and lemon juice. Serve the tuna salad on top of the baked sweet potato.

10. Chicken and Vegetable Kabobs: Skewer chicken cubes and vegetables such as bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms. Brush with olive oil and grill or bake until cooked through. Serve with a side of quinoa or couscous.

These are just a few ideas to get you started. You can also experiment with different combinations of ingredients and spices to create your own unique dishes.
